module.name: appearance_assignment
module.keywords: module, appearance assignment, styled element, visual attributes
module.purpose:
This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the assignment of visual attributes to shape models, geometric elements and annotation elements.
It specifies the resources for the assignment of visual attributes to styled models and geometric or annotation elements, but does not include specifications of those attributes.
The second edition of this part of ISO 10303 included the modifications to the first edition listed below.
The following ARM EXPRESS declarations have been modified:
Context_dependent_appearance_assignment;
Styled_model.
The following ARM EXPRESS declarations have been added:
appearance_context;
appearance_select;
Mapping_based_styled_model;
Over_riding_styled_item;
Transformation_based_styled_model.
The following ARM EXPRESS data types have been removed:
Appearance (replaced by appearance_select);
Appearance_context (replaced by the appearance_context type);
Context_dependent_overriding_styled_element.
The definitions of the following ARM EXPRESS data types have been modified:
Styled_model.
In addition, modifications have been made to the mapping specification, the MIM schema and the EXPRESS-G diagrams to reflect and be consistent with the modifications of the ARM.
This third edition of this part of ISO 10303 includes the modifications to the second edition listed below.
The following MIM EXPRESS declarations have been added:
style_context_select in USE FROM list from presentation_appearance_schema.
Modifications made to the mapping syntax:
Transformation_based_styled_model.replication_transformation (to Cartesian_transformation_2d) and Transformation_based_styled_model.replication_transformation (to Cartesian_transformation_3d).
